title: Secure and Efficient Federated Learning for Smart Grid With Edge-Cloud Collaboration
summaries: in the hierarchical FL framework, propose __a rewarding scheme by considering the inference accuracy and cost__ for private energy data sharing in smart grids with edge-cloud collaboration
systemModel: __Cloud__: where tasks are hosted, and is publicly accessed and capable of computing power, communication, and storage
each aggregator offers edge computing and wireless communication services within a specific area
$\mathbb{I}_m=\{1,...,i,...,I_m\}$: the set of EDOs in the coverage of $m$
__Energy Data Owners (EDOs)__: $\mathbb{I}=\{1,...,i,...,I\}$ with heterogeneous private energy dataset $\mathbb{S}_i$ [see Local Data Properties]
EDOs can be owner of the smart home or smart building
private dataset can be generated by his smart meters, home applicances, solar panels, electric vehicles, etc
$\mathbb{I}_{j,k}=\{1,...,i,...,I_{j,k}\}$ denotes the set of EDOs that join the task $\Upsilon_{j,k}$
ESP publishes task $\Upsilon_{j,k}$; cloud initializes a global model $\Theta_{j,k}^n$ ($n=0$))<ol>
Each EDO trains the global model $\Theta_{j,k}^{n-1}$; gets a local model $\Theta_{i,j,k}^n$; sends to corresponding aggregator [see Payoff Function of EDO]
Each aggregator performs edge aggregation; sends intermediate results $\tilde{\Theta}_{m,j,k}^n$ and data size $\tilde{S}_{m,j,k}$ to cloud
The cloud updates current global model to get $\Theta_{j,k}^{n}$; calculates payments to involved EDOs
techniques: earth mover's distance (EMD): dissimilarities of local data distributions: $\Delta_{i,j,k}=\sum_{u=1}^Y\Vert\mathcal{P}_{i,j,k}(y=u)-\mathcal{P}_{j,k}(y=u)\Vert$
the article didn't mention how this data quality is calculated
$\bar{\omega}$: weight parameter to balance revenue and cost
$\kappa_p$: the adjustment parameter (don't know what to adjust)
$p_{i,j,k}$: payment for the highest AoLM of $i$
